name: Shape Factory (Raphael)
description:
The shapes produced in your factory are upgraded (to a shape with more sides) when a similar shape falls on them. Switch the conveyor belt on and off to control what pieces receive the falling shapes. Try to merge as many shapes as you can before  you go home for the day, but don't let too many triangles or squares leave the screen, or you might get fired!

Controls:

This game can be played with just a mouse (or touchscreen). All you need to do is click the switch, and whatever menu buttons you need. However, the game can also be operated with a keyboard. Use the arrow keys or WASD to move around the menu, use Space or Enter/Return to select options in the menu or flick the switch during the game, and use ESC to pause the game.

This game is a work in progress! I got it to a level where I'm just barely fine with people seeing it and published it, just to make sure that I submit it in time for GeoJam 2021, but I'll be going back and adding more features and fixing any bugs that I notice or that have been pointed out (so feedback is welcome!).

All assets were made by me using HTML/CSS/JavaScript on repl.it, SVG code in my own editor, Bandlab, and a drawing app on my phone (for the background).
